@livecoin_net @cryptonite_01 @sc0rp1onCrypto The problem with this, the dbix network is a decentralised network with no profit for itself. It's exactly like BTC if it's doubled spent the devs cannot be responsible for a payout. We may consider somethitng for the community in the new network but that will be on the long run.

@livecoin_net @cryptonite_01 @sc0rp1onCrypto distributing the loss among all wallets is a way to move forward, each wallet will then bare a percentage of their holding on the exchange as a loss and they can reopen withdrawals. this solution can be easily implemented, we just need to confirm the exact amount.

@livecoin_net @sc0rp1onCrypto @cryptonite_01 to figure out a proper solution that's fair for everyone we need time and we are open for community suggestions before that which could help expedite the process. Livecoin can solve this today if they wanted but unfortunately it seems higly unlikely.
@livecoin_net @sc0rp1onCrypto @cryptonite_01 We agree!

@livecoin_net @sc0rp1onCrypto @cryptonite_01 We need to think together as a community for options and decid on the way forward then. We will try to come up with some suggestions to help start this process in the coming weeks.

@livecoin_net @sc0rp1onCrypto @cryptonite_01 What livecoin is asking is that we pay 70k dbix which is ridiculous since it's an open source decentralised project and we had no premine for the team and no ICO. This is what we mean by not bailing them out.

@livecoin_net @cryptonite_01 @sc0rp1onCrypto They're taking no responsibility for a loss that would've been easily prevented if they had high number of confirmations and proper kyc measures at their exchange. We're keen to help the community but we won't just bail livecoin out, especially after their misguided reporting.
